Understate: The claim understates the fact that at least one GOP candidate, Marco Rubio, has discussed how to address the rising cost of college.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that none of the 17 GOP candidates have discussed the issue.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as some other GOP candidates, like Chris Christie and Carly Fiorina, have also discussed college costs and proposed ideas for reform.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Marco Rubio has made college costs a major platform plank.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that not a single GOP candidate has discussed the issue, when in fact some candidates have addressed it.
